t: John 21
After*p these things Jesus shewed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias; and on this wise shewed he himself.
There*p were together Simon Peter, and Thomas called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two other of his disciples.
Simon*p Peter saith unto them, I go a fishing. They say unto him, We also go with thee. They went forth, and entered into a ship immediately; and that night they caught nothing.
But*p when the morning was now come, Jesus stood on the shore: but the disciples knew not that it was Jesus.
Then*p Jesus saith unto them, Children,*r have*r ye*r any*r meat?*r They answered him, No.

And*p he said unto them, Cast*r the*r net*r on*r the*r right*r side*r of*r the*r ship,*r and*r ye*r shall*r find.*r They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.

Therefore*p that disciple whom Jesus loved saith unto Peter, It is the Lord. Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girt his fisher's coat unto him, (for he was naked,) and did cast himself into the sea.
And*p the other disciples came in a little ship; (for they were not far from land, but as it were two hundred cubits,) dragging the net with fishes.
As*p soon then as they were come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.
Jesus*p saith unto them, Bring*r of*r the*r fish*r which*r ye*r have*r now*r caught.*r
Simon*p Peter went up, and drew the net to land full of great fishes, an hundred and fifty and three: and for all there were so many, yet was not the net broken.
Jesus*p saith unto them, Come*r and*r dine.*r And none of the disciples durst ask him, Who art thou? knowing that it was the Lord.
Jesus*p then cometh, and taketh bread, and giveth them, and fish likewise.
This*p is now the third time that Jesus shewed himself to his disciples, after that he was risen from the dead.

So*p when they had dined, Jesus saith to Simon Peter, Simon,*r son*r of*r Jonas,*r lovest*r thou*r me*r more*r than*r these?*r He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed*r my*r lambs.*r
He*p saith to him again the second time, Simon,*r son*r of*r Jonas,*r lovest*r thou*r me?*r He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed*r my*r sheep.*r

He*p saith unto him the third time, Simon,*r son*r of*r Jonas,*r lovest*r thou*r me?*r Peter was grieved because he said unto him the third time, Lovest thou me? And he said unto him, Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I love thee. Jesus saith unto him, Feed*r my*r sheep.*r

Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r thee,*r When*r thou*r wast*r young,*r thou*r girdedst*r thyself,*r and*r walkedst*r whither*r thou*r wouldest:*r but*r when*r thou*r shalt*r be*r old,*r thou*r shalt*r stretch*r forth*r thy*r hands,*r and*r another*r shall*r gird*r thee,*r and*r carry*r thee*r whither*r thou*r wouldest*r not.*r
This*p spake he, signifying by what death he should glorify God. And when he had spoken this, he saith unto him, Follow*r me.*r
Then*p Peter, turning about, seeth the disciple whom Jesus loved following; which also leaned on his breast at supper, and said, Lord, which is he that betrayeth thee?
Peter*p seeing him saith to Jesus, Lord, and what shall this man do?
Jesus*p saith unto him, If*r I*r will*r that*r he*r tarry*r till*r I*r come,*r what*r is*r that*r to*r thee?*r follow*r thou*r me.*r

Then*p went this saying abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die: yet Jesus said not unto him, He shall not die; but, If*r I*r will*r that*r he*r tarry*r till*r I*r come,*r what*r is*r that*r to*r thee?*r
This*p is the disciple which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things: and we know that his testimony is true.
And*p there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which, if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written. Amen.
